item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Trade Higher; Broader Indices Outperform - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Highlights: Nifty, Sensex Extend Gains For Second Straight Session

Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The NSE Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex extended gains for the second straight session ahead of the US CPI data, with key stocks showing positive movement.

  • The Nifty 50 ended 37.15 points or 0.16% higher at 23,213.20.
  • The Sensex ended 224.45 points or 0.29% higher at 76,724.08.
  • Top gainers included NTPC, Trent Ltd, and Power Grid Corporation Ltd.
  • Sector performance saw Nifty Realty rise the most while Nifty Media declined.
  • Market breadth indicated 2,144 stocks rose, while 1,808 fell.
“The Nifty 50 rose 0.51% to a day's high of 23,293.65.”

Overall, the market sentiment remained cautiously optimistic as traders awaited further cues.

item.title: Mahindra To Showcase 4 New SUVs At Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Mahindra To Showcase 4 New SUVs At Auto Expo

Date: January 25, 2025
Source: MotorOctane

The upcoming Auto Expo is set to feature exciting new electric SUVs from Mahindra, showcasing models like the Rall-E concept, XEV 7e, XUV3XO EV, and Thar E.

  • Mahindra will present the Rall-E concept, an off-road variant of the BE 6 with rugged design and accessories.
  • The XEV 7e will be based on the XUV700 and offer three-row seating and advanced features.
  • The XUV3XO EV is expected to debut with designs from the XUV3XO, emphasizing affordability and performance.
  • The Thar E aims to build on the success of the Thar Roxx with a 5-door layout and advanced off-road capability.
“The Thar E will explore the off-road segment further with an AWD configuration, enhancing its appeal.”

This Auto Expo is set to be vital for Mahindra as it positions itself strongly in the growing electric vehicle market in India.

item.title: 'Look to yourself if employees aren't working...': Raghuram Rajan responds to L&T chief's 90-hour work week pitch - Business Today
item.description:
'Look to yourself if employees aren't working...': Raghuram Rajan responds to L&T chief's 90-hour work week pitch

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Business Today

Former Reserve Bank of India Governor Raghuram Rajan criticized L&T Chairperson SN Subrahmanyan's suggestion of a 90-hour work week, stating it reflects generational complaints about younger workers.

  • Rajan believes there cannot be a one-size-fits-all approach to work hours.
  • He emphasized the importance of individuals finding balance in their work and personal interests.
  • Subrahmanyan's comments ignited backlash regarding work-life balance considerations.
  • Experts suggest that quality of work should trump quantity of hours worked.
“If they're not working to the extent that you want them to work in your firm, look to yourself what is it that you're doing wrong in incentivising them.” - Raghuram Rajan

Rajan concluded that meaningful work cannot be reduced to rigid designs and that fulfilling work is often subjective.

item.title: Boeing CEO in India in his first overseas visit - The Hindu
item.description:
Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg Visits India for First Overseas Engagement

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Boeing’s new President and CEO Kelly Ortberg is in India this week for his first international visit since taking over in August. His agenda includes meetings with Boeing customers and key government stakeholders, along with visits to Boeing’s facilities.

  • Ortberg's visit spans nearly three days.
  • Meetings with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and other Boeing executives were held.
  • Boeing has a joint venture with Tata in aerospace manufacturing in India.
  • Challenges faced by Boeing include regulatory oversight and production slowdowns.
  • Delays in 737 MAX deliveries are impacting Indian airlines.
“Grateful to @nsitharaman for a productive discussion with @Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg. Our partnership with India continues to grow...” - Salil Gupte, President of Boeing India

Ortberg's visit reflects Boeing's commitment to expanding its presence in India despite ongoing challenges in production and delivery.

item.title: 'Amul stares at bread daily': Dairy brand joins 90-hour workweek controversy with new doodle - The Times of India
item.description:
Amul Joins 90-Hour Workweek Debate with New Doodle

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a recent twist to the ongoing 90-hour workweek controversy, Amul has released a new doodle that captures public attention and reflects the brand's engagement with current social issues.

  • The doodle addresses the intense debates around work-life balance and labor rights.
  • Amul's campaign symbolizes corporate awareness of social issues affecting employees.
  • It has sparked discussions across various social media platforms.
"Amul's doodles often resonate with the public, creating cultural connections and sparking conversations on important topics."

This campaign not only highlights Amul's marketing creativity but also underlines the importance of addressing contemporary workplace issues in India.

item.title: NIFTY50 rejig: Zomato, Jio Financial may join NIFTY50, replacing BPCL and Britannia; check details - Upstox
item.description:
Zomato and Jio Financial Likely to Join NIFTY50 in Upcoming Rejig

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 Source: JM Financial

Zomato and Jio Financial Services are set to replace BPCL and Britannia in the NIFTY50 index during its semi-annual rejig in March.

  • Zomato and Jio Financial are expected to be included in NIFTY50 based on free-float market cap.
  • JM Financial expects Zomato to see inflows of ₹5,364 crore if included.
  • Jio Financial could see inflows of ₹3,080 crore.
  • Inclusion criteria require a market impact cost of 0.5% or less and trading in futures/options.
  • BPCL and Britannia may face significant outflows if excluded.
"If Zomato is included in NIFTY 50, it may see an inflow of $620 million, or ₹5,364 crore, which is 3.8 times its average daily trading volume."

In conclusion, the upcoming reshuffle of the NIFTY50 index may significantly impact the trading dynamics of Zomato and Jio Financial, while BPCL and Britannia face potential outflows.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty Rises Over 0.20% As NTPC, Power Grid Lead; Sensex Trades Above 76,700 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty Rises Over 0.20% As NTPC, Power Grid Lead; Sensex Trades Above 76,700

Publication Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

Indian stock indices are showing positive movements today, with both Nifty and Sensex rising significantly, propelled by major stocks such as NTPC and Power Grid.

  • Nifty rose by 0.51%, reaching 23,293.65 points.
  • Sensex increased by 0.64%, hitting 76,991.05 points.
  • Broader indices like Nifty Midcap and Smallcap also advanced.
  • NTPC, Power Grid, and Trent emerged as top gainers on the Nifty.
  • HDFC Life, Mahindra & Mahindra, and Bajaj Finance were noted as top losers.
“The stock market is reacting positively with major gains across sectors.”

The trends suggest a bullish sentiment in the market, with investors optimistic about upcoming corporate earnings and overall economic stability.

item.title: Mid-day Mood | Sensex falls 500 points from day's high, Nifty breaks below 23,200 - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Mid-day Mood | Sensex falls 500 points from day's high, Nifty breaks below 23,200

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

The market showed volatility as Sensex dropped significantly from its high, with various sectors reflecting mixed performance. Analysts spotted a bullish harami pattern, indicating potential future gains.

  • Sensex fell nearly 500 points from the day's high, trading around 76,504.
  • Nifty dropped below the 23,200 mark amid a flat trading session.
  • Market breadth remained positive with 2,123 shares advancing versus 1,296 shares declining.
  • Analysts recommend pushing Nifty above 23,340 for further gains.
“The Nifty’s rebound has formed a 'bullish harami' pattern.”

The current market conditions indicate caution, yet opportunities for recovery exist as indicated by market analysts.

item.title: YES Bank, IREDA, Paytm, MGL: Top mid-cap and small-cap stocks that MFs lapped up in December | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
YES Bank, IREDA, Paytm, MGL: Top mid-cap and small-cap stocks that MFs lapped up in December

Publication Date: December 2023 Source: Live Mint

Mutual funds (MFs) have been actively buying mid-cap and small-cap stocks, influencing market trends and offering higher potential returns with increased risk.

Key Points:

  • In December, MFs were net buyers of 60% of Nifty Midcap 100 and 53% of Nifty Smallcap 100 stocks.
  • Top purchases included Yes Bank, HUDCO, Tata Elxsi, Godrej Properties, and IREDA.
  • Yes Bank saw a 166.7% month-on-month increase in MFs' stake, totaling ₹430 crore.
  • In HUDCO, MFs increased stakes by 93%, while Tata Elxsi increased by 77.6%.
  • Signature Global and Mahanagar Gas were the top small-cap purchases, with increases between 12-40%.
  • Profits were booked in Tata Technologies and Vodafone Idea, with stakes reduced by 16% and 13%, respectively.
  • Overall, MFs recorded a net inflow of ₹41,155 crore in equity mutual funds in December, marking a near 15% increase from the previous month.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“Retail investors often gravitate towards mid-cap and small-cap stocks as these counters have the possibility of delivering higher returns but at the cost of higher risk.”

Conclusion:

The active buying from MFs in mid-cap and small-cap stocks signals a positive outlook despite inherent risks, with significant shifts in shareholding across key companies offering insights for retail investors.

item.title: Shoppers Stop shares jump 6% after firm’s Q3 net profit rises 42% - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Shoppers Stop Shares Surge 6% Following 42% Increase in Q3 Net Profit

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Shoppers Stop shares jumped nearly 6% following a strong quarterly performance in Q3 FY25, which saw a 42% year-on-year increase in net profit.

  • Net profit reached Rs 52.23 crore, up from a loss of Rs 20.78 crore in Q2 FY25.
  • Revenue from operations rose 11% to Rs 1,379.47 crore compared to Q3 FY24.
  • Strong demand for premium products contributed significantly to revenue growth.
  • Premium categories accounted for 64% of overall revenue in Q3, marking a 9% year-on-year increase.
“The rise in Q3 profit may have been further boosted by the rise in demand during the quarter, amid multiple festivals in India including Diwali.”

This performance highlights Shoppers Stop's recovery and the significance of festive season sales in boosting retail brands' profitability.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty Trades Above 23,200 As NTPC, Maruti Suzuki Lead; Sensex Rises Over 300 Points - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty Trades Above 23,200 As NTPC, Maruti Suzuki Lead; Sensex Rises Over 300 Points

Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The Nifty 50 opened higher, trading 74.40 points or 0.32% above 23,200, while the Sensex saw a gain of over 300 points, bolstered by strong performances from NTPC and Maruti Suzuki.

  • Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, and Maruti Suzuki contribute to the Nifty 50 index.
  • HDFC AMC shares rise over 4% after positive quarterly results.
  • Adani Power and Adani Green shares continue their rally for a second consecutive day.
  • HUDCO to consider raising borrowings to Rs 55,000 crore.
  • Adani Green's operational capacity increased by 37% year-on-year.
“The Nifty 50 opened 74.40 points or 0.32% up at 23,250.45.”

This positive trend in the stock market shows resilience despite previous fluctuations, suggesting investor confidence in recovery and growth.

item.title: Adani Green Energy share price extends rally to 2nd day, jumps another 7%. Here's why | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Adani Green Energy Share Price Extends Rally

Publication Date: January 15, 2024
Source: Live Mint

Adani Green Energy shares are experiencing a significant upward trend, gaining 7.35% today on top of a 13.16% increase the previous day.

This surge follows multiple positive developments, including the commissioning of a 57.2 MW wind power component and a notable increase in operational capacity.

  • Adani Green shares rose 7.35% to ₹1,080 each.
  • The total two-day rise is approximately 20%.
  • Operational renewable generation capacity now totals 11,666.1 MW.
  • The company reported a 37% YoY increase in operational capacity for 9M FY25.
  • Energy sales increased by 23% YoY.
  • Adani Green aims to achieve 50 GW of renewable capacity by 2030.
“The solar capacity added in 2024 is the highest recorded in any single year so far.”

The positive momentum in Adani Green Energy's shares indicates strong performance and potential growth in India's renewable energy sector.

item.title: HDFC Asset Management Company Q3 Results 2025 on 15 Jan, 2025: profit rise by 31.45% YOY, profit at ₹641.36 crore and revenue at ₹934.63 crore | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
HDFC Asset Management Company Q3 Results 2025

Publication Date: 15 Jan, 2025 | Source: LiveMint

HDFC Asset Management Company has reported a significant growth in its Q3 results for FY2025, with profits and revenues showing notable year-on-year increases.

  • Profit increased by 31.45% YOY, reaching ₹641.36 crore.
  • Revenue grew by 39.22% YOY to ₹934.63 crore.
  • Quarter-on-quarter, revenue rose by 5.34% and profit increased by 11.23%.
  • Operating income increased by 8.63% quarter-on-quarter and surged by 51.17% year-on-year.
  • Earnings Per Share (EPS) for Q3 is reported at ₹29.9, up by 31.03% from the same quarter last year.
“The consensus recommendation is to Buy among 22 analysts.”

HDFC Asset Management Company currently holds a market cap of ₹82,618.05 crore, with a 52-week high of ₹4864 and a low of ₹3256.

item.title: Zucking up? Mark Zuckerberg to cohost reception for Trump inauguration, but not with wife Priscilla - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mark Zuckerberg will cohost a reception next week for Donald Trump’s inauguration, but not with his wife Priscilla Chan.

Date: Jan 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mark Zuckerberg, CEO of Meta, will cohost a wealth-focused black tie reception for Donald Trump’s inauguration alongside prominent Republican donors, but his wife Priscilla Chan will not be cohosting with him, which has sparked social media attention.

  • Zuckerberg is co-hosting a reception for Trump’s inauguration with several billionaire Republican donors.
  • Priscilla Chan's absence from the guest list was noted on social media.
  • The reception is seen as Zuckerberg’s attempt to align with Trump’s conservative viewpoints.
  • Other notable cohosts include Miriam Adelson and Todd Ricketts.
“More Zucking up... Zuckerberg to host an inaugural ball reception for Trump and Vance…” - Tara Palmeri

This reception may reflect Zuckerberg's ongoing efforts to build relationships with influential conservatives as he navigates political pressures within the tech industry.

item.title: Stock split by IT company: Ex-date, record date on Jan 20 - ET Now
item.description:
Stock Split Announcement by Blue Cloud Softech Solutions on January 20

Publication Date: Updated Jan 15, 2025 11:22 IST

Source: ET NOW

Blue Cloud Softech Solutions, a Hyderabad-based IT company, is set to undergo a stock split, announcing January 20 as the ex-date and record date for this corporate action.

  • The shares will split in a ratio of 2:1, reducing the face value from Rs 2 to Re 1.
  • This is the second stock split for Blue Cloud Softech Solutions; the first was in 2026 with a 5:1 split.
  • The company's shares have increased over 2% to trade at Rs 88.70 as of the announcement.
  • In the past year, the shares have seen a 38% positive return, and a remarkable 617% increase over two years.
  • The company has a market capitalization of Rs 1,934.69 crore.
“The company has fixed Monday, 20th Day of January, 2025 as ‘Record Date’ for the purpose of determining the eligibility of shareholders”

This event highlights the company's consistent growth and aims to enhance shareholder value through the split.

item.title: Adani Group in advanced talks to acquire majority stake in Emaar India for Rs 5,000 cr: Report - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Adani Group in advanced talks to acquire majority stake in Emaar India for Rs 5,000 cr: Report

Date: January 15, 2025 / 11:11 IST

Source: Moneycontrol

Adani Group is reportedly in advanced negotiations with Dubai-based Emaar Properties to acquire a majority stake in its Indian arm, Emaar India, for an estimated Rs 4,000-5,000 crore.

  • The acquisition would involve 70-100% ownership of Emaar India through Adani Realty.
  • The deal could reach Rs 5,000 crore based on negotiations.
  • This would be Adani Group’s largest purchase in the real estate sector.
  • Emaar India has expanded its portfolio across key Indian cities since its split with MGF Developments Ltd in 2016.
  • Emaar India reported total income of Rs 2,756.6 crore for FY24, up from Rs 1,765.8 crore in the previous year.
“This acquisition will mark Adani Group’s largest purchase in the real estate sector.”

The potential acquisition illustrates Adani Group's growth strategy in real estate, expanding its footprint and influence in the market.

item.title: Weakening rupee puts India interest rate cuts in doubt - Financial Times
item.description:
Weakening Rupee Raises Doubts About India's Interest Rate Cuts

Date: January 2024

Source: Financial Times

A drop in the value of India’s rupee has shaken expectations for interest rate cuts by the central bank to stimulate the economy amidst a backdrop of rising inflation and economic slowdown.

  • India's rupee has fallen 0.7% against the dollar, marking its largest one-day drop in nearly two years.
  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) was expected to cut the benchmark repo rate from 6.5%, but the falling currency complicates this decision.
  • India's GDP growth fell to 5.4% in the September quarter, its lowest in nearly two years.
  • The RBI has intervened in currency markets, depleting significant foreign reserves to support the rupee.
  • Experts are divided on the implications of the rupee's decline, with some suggesting the RBI has room for maneuver amidst declining inflation.
“It’s not an easy environment for the new governor.” - Trinh Nguyen, economist at Natixis

The ongoing situation poses challenges for India's economic outlook, particularly given its reliance on imports and the necessity for effective monetary policy in response to external pressures.

item.title: ABFRL approves Rs 2,400 crore preferential issue for promoters, QIB - The Economic Times
item.description:
ABFRL Approves Rs 2,400 Crore Share Issuance for Promoters and QIBs

Publication Date: Wednesday

Source: Economic Times

Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited (ABFRL) has approved a preferential issue of shares worth approximately Rs 2,379 crore to promoters and qualified institutional buyers.

  • ABFRL approved the issuance of up to 4,08,72,580 equity shares at an issue price of Rs 317.45 per share.
  • The total consideration for promoter group shares is up to Rs 1,297.5 crore, increasing Pilani Investment and Industries' stake from 0.37% to 3.9%.
  • The company will also raise Rs 1,081.25 crore at a price of Rs 272.37 per share from QIBs, including various Fidelity funds.
  • Following the announcement, ABFRL's shares traded around 0.43% lower at Rs 269.20.
  • The stock has underperformed benchmark indices with less than 5% returns over the last year.

The company previously announced the demerger of its Madura business into a separate entity named ABLBL, which will comprise multiple lifestyle and sportswear brands.

ABFRL will continue to manage its retail business under brands like Pantaloons and Style Up, as well as ethnic brands such as Sabyasachi and Tarun Tahiliani.

In conclusion, this significant fundraising move is aimed at strengthening the company's financial position as it navigates competitive retail challenges.

item.title: Neither GQG nor LIC, mutual funds played Adani bull in Q3 - The Economic Times
item.description:
Neither GQG nor LIC, mutual funds played Adani bull in Q3

Publication Date: December Quarter 2023, Source: Economic Times

During the December quarter, domestic mutual funds increased their stakes in several Adani Group stocks while foreign investors reduced their holdings amidst a bribery scandal involving the company.

  • Mutual funds increased their holdings in six Adani Group stocks.
  • Foreign investors, including GQG Partners, reduced their stakes in Adani Group stocks.
  • LIC maintained most of its positions with minor adjustments.
  • FII holdings in Adani Ports, Green Energy, Energy Solutions, and Ambuja Cements decreased significantly.
“APSEZ is poised to surpass India's maritime growth, leveraging its strategically balanced port network across the western & eastern coasts.”

The article highlights the contrasting strategies of domestic mutual funds and foreign investors in light of recent challenges facing the Adani Group, suggesting a resilience among local investors.

item.title: Mahindra XEV 7e design leaked ahead of imminent launch. Here's what to expect - HT Auto
item.description:
Mahindra XEV 7e: The Electric Avatar of XUV700

Publication Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

The Mahindra XEV 7e is set to launch as an electric version of the popular XUV700, sharing design elements with the recently unveiled XEV 9e. This SUV promises an impressive range and modern features aimed at enhancing the driving experience.

  • Design philosophy similar to the Mahindra XEV 9e electric SUV-coupe.
  • Features like inverted L-shaped LED daytime running lights and a split LED projector headlight setup.
  • Aerodynamically designed alloy wheels.
  • Expected dual-spoke steering wheel with illuminated logo.
  • Available battery options: 59 kWh (550 km range) and 79 kWh (650 km range).
"The Mahindra XEV 7e will offer a modern tech-savvy cabin expected to include a triple-screen setup and advanced safety features."

The Mahindra XEV 7e represents a significant step in Mahindra's electric vehicle strategy, aligning with global trends towards electrification in the automotive industry.

item.title: IRFC shares surge over 3% as company emerges lowest bidder for ₹3,167 crore project in Jharkhand; all you need to know - Upstox
item.description:
IRFC Shares Surge Over 3% as Company Wins ₹3,167 Crore Project Bid

Date: January 15, 2024 | Source: PTI

Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) rose by 3.65% after being announced as the lowest bidder for a significant financing project in Jharkhand.

IRFC is set to finance ₹3,167 crore for the development of the Banhardih Coal Block, managed by a joint venture with NTPC and Jharkhand Bijli Vitran Nigam Limited.

  • IRFC shares increased by 3.65% to ₹140.50 on the NSE.
  • The company has reported a nearly 5% share growth over the past year.
  • In Q2 FY25, IRFC's net profit rose to ₹1,613 crore, an increase of 4% year-on-year.
  • The board approved an interim dividend of ₹0.80/share for the fiscal year.
“IRFC will strengthen the financial ecosystem for railway infrastructure projects,” said IRFC Chairman Manoj Kumar Dubey.

The surge in IRFC shares reflects positive investor sentiment following this significant project tender win, contributing to both the company's growth and its role in supporting Indian Railways.
